cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 mi SE of Miami, Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to turn WNW then NW)

cyclone.trajectory: Irma is moving west-northwest along the north coast of Cuba, is forecast to turn northwest late Saturday, then track across the Florida Keys and up the southwest coast of Florida toward the central Gulf coast of the peninsula.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Keys or extreme southwest Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Jupiter Inlet to the Flagler/Volusia County Line (Atlantic side) and north of Bonita Beach to Anclote River (Gulf side, includes Manatee County coast).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Jupiter Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach; Florida Keys; Lake Okeechobee.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southern and southwestern Florida coastline including Florida Keys and the lower/middle Gulf coast up to Tampa Bay area.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely by Sunday with a 52% chance of 50-kt winds and a 33% chance of hurricane-force winds (64 kt) in the Tampa Bay area. Expect sustained gale to minimal-hurricane winds with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–6 ft above ground possible along the Manatee/Sarasota coast and into Tampa Bay as the hurricane’s onshore flow moves northward.
weather_observation.rainfall: Western Florida peninsula expected to receive 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches; flash flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands; very rough seas and dangerous rip currents, forcing likely closure of the port navigation channel.
